text:
Hi all I am Avon, my background is in music (guitar + pure data) and delay tolerant networking. I actually found future of coding through the podcast episode with pd creator Miller Puckette.
My current interest is in building collaborative, itemized, computing environments, inspired by the writings of <https://alexanderobenauer.com/articles/os/1/|Alexander Obenauer>. The current path I'm taking towards this goal is working with <https://project-mage.org/|Project Mage>, and trying to connect Mage's data representation system called <https://www.ri.cmu.edu/pub_files/pub3/giuse_dario_1987_1/giuse_dario_1987_1.pdf|KR>, to a delay-tolerant data synchronization protocol called <https://code.briarproject.org/briar/briar-spec/blob/master/protocols/BSP.md|Bramble>. You can read more about this idea here: <https://lists.sr.ht/~project-mage/discussions/%3C6fb9dbc5-1c58-cf36-5dcb-8cd1813e3cc4%40gmail.com%3E>

My overarching goal with this work is to build the tools necessary to create multi-computer, collaborative computing environments. Initially this is just going to be software, but eventually I would like to branch into physical environments and explore how this software interacts with alternative human computer interfaces like Dynamicland, possibly paired with modular building systems like <https://openstructures.family/about|OpenStructures> and <https://gridbeam.xyz/|GridBeams>.
 
Feeling really grateful that I found a community of others interested in similar ideas. :smiley:

Cheers,

Avon (@t400@iffy.info)

text:
I had not seen KR before. One thing I think that systems like this really need is inheritance/aliasing of property/link names as well as values. 

If you want lots of people to collaborate efficiently on something like this I think you need to incorporate lots of slack/slop and give the ability to easily plug in the missing plumbing as and when it is required.

FYI <@U03KUD5SZHD> occasionally posts here.
